title: Datasets
text:
I think ShinyApps and dashboards are great tools to explore and interactively work with new datasets which is why we developed the following applications along with our datasets:

The TOSCO ShinyDashboard (put together with the TOSCO team) provides data on ownership of Internet service providers (ISPs) and several applications to explore these ownership structures and state control over ISPs.
The ERT ShinyApp (put together with Sebastian Hellmeier) provides several interactive applications allowing users to flexibly adjust the parameters of the ERT dataset (see below) and test their validity.

title: Datasets
text:
Episodes of Regime Transformation (ERT)
Identifies episodes of democratization (liberalizing autocracy, democratic deepening) and autocratization (democratic regression, autocratic regression) in the most recent V-Dem dataset, the dataset is freely available here. We also provide the ERT R package as a user-friendly tool to flexibly work with the dataset.

Varieties of Democracy (V-Dem) Project, 2025.

title: Datasets
text:
Pandemic Backsliding
ThePandemic Backsliding project tracks state responses to Covid-19 and their potential effect on the overall quality of democracy within the country. The current version of the data reflects the situation between March 2020 and June 2021. The data is freely available here, more information about the project here.

title: Datasets
text:
Varieties of Democracy (V-Dem), Version 11.1.
I contributed to Version 11.1. of the Varieties of Democracy (V-Dem) dataset. The V-Dem dataset includes the world’s most comprehensive and detailed democracy ratings. The dataset and associated reference documents are freely available here.
Together with a few colleagues, we put together the vdemdata R package as a user-friendly tool to work with the latest version of the V-Dem dataset.

Welcome!
I am a Senior Lecturer in Political Science (Research Methods) at the University of Melbourne. Before, I held positions as Assistant Professor at the Goethe University in Frankfurt am Main, Germany, and the Varieties of Democracy (V-Dem) Institute in Gothenburg, Sweden. I was Principal Investigator and Project Leader of the DFG-funded project on digital authoritarianism. The different sections of this website provide an overview of my publications, research projects, datasets, and teaching experience. You find my CV here.
My research interests are:

Democracy, authoritarianism, regime change
Political communication, internet politics, AI in politics
Quantitative methods, computational text analysis, large language models (LLMs)

I am co-founder of QuantLab, a new network group aiming to bring together social scientists at the University of Melbourne and beyond to share insights in cutting-edge quantitative methods and research. I offer free online tutorials and accessible online workshops about how to use and fine-tune Large Language Models for text analysis on Instats, check out my on-demand online workshop on Using AI for Text Analysis in R (Introduction) or the advanced version Using AI for Text Analysis (Advanced Applications).

In quantitative comparative politics, publishing peer-reviewed and highly-cited articles in top journals is a key indicator of influence in the field and often preferred over book publications due to the lag time associated with book publishing. Publications are frequently co-authored to combine methodological skills.
